column4: Friend of mine has got a HP ProLiant MicroServer for amateur server use. Trying to install Ubuntu server on it however on the partitioning only option is iSCSI, dont know where to go from here, help appreciated
is it a sata drive?
yes
then it comes up as a sda drive
we are at partition disks on the server install, no options there but iSCSI
can't you select iSCSI and parititon then?
kk press iSCSI and it asks for ip address, no idea what it is looked on hard drive no ip on there
hrm.... hit alt+f2 to switch to a busy box shell
fdisk -l
also you can use manual partitioning if the guided isn't working.
kk sec waiting for friend to type fdisk output
see if it lists the internal hard disk that's all
thats ll there is there
what are you booting the ubuntu installer off of.
USB
what versioni of ubuntu server?
hrm.. yeah the kernel the installer is booting doesn't see the disk
what should i do
got any ideas?
off for today, any last ideas?
oh well thanks for your help, cya
np
